prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating a Curved Rectangular Prism Construct a curved rectangular prism with the following dimensions: 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism has a curved side with a radius of 0.5 units. Step 1: Creating a coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 * Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 Step 2: Drawing the 2D sketch 1. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: * (0.0, 0.0) * (0.25, 0.0) * (0.5, 0.75) * (0.0, 0.75) 3. Connect the endpoints of the rectangle with arcs, creating a shape similar to a quarter circle. 4. Add a fillet to the four corners of the rectangle with a radius of 0.1 units. Step 3: Scaling and transforming the 2D sketch 1. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. 2. Transform the sketch using the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) from the coordinate system. Step 4: Extruding the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch with the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.25 * Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body This completes the instructions for creating Part 1 with the description: "A 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units." The height, width and length of the part are: 0.25, 0.75 and 0.75 units respectively. Note: These instructions assume that the CAD software being used is capable of recognizing and constructing the described curves and fillets. If not, the curves may need to be approximated using line segments or arcs. Similarly, fillets may need to be approximated using smaller, adjacent arcs.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.25,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.25]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.25],"End Point":[0.5,0.25]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.25],"End Point":[0.5,0.75]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.75],"End Point":[0.25,0.75]},"line_8":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.75],"End Point":[0.25,0.25]},"line_9":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.25]},"line_10":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.25,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge.** Start by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5478, 0.0] Next, draw the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system with the following curves and loops: 1. Draw a line (line\\_1) with start point [0.0, 0.3302] and end point [0.414, 0.3302]. 2. Draw an arc (arc\\_1) with the following properties: - Start Point: [0.414, 0.3302] - Mid Point: [0.4294, 0.3267] - End Point: [0.4419, 0.3171] 3. Draw a line (line\\_2) with start point [0.4419, 0.3171] and end point [0.708, 0.0]. 4. Draw a line (line\\_3) with start point [0.708, 0.0] and end point [0.75, 0.0352]. 5. Draw a line (line\\_4) with start point [0.75, 0.0352] and end point [0.4839, 0.3523]. 6. Draw an arc (arc\\_2) with the following properties: - Start Point: [0.4839, 0.3523] - Mid Point: [0.4526, 0.3764] - End Point: [0.414, 0.3849] 7. Draw a line (line\\_5) with start point [0.414, 0.3849] and end point [0.0, 0.3849]. 8. Draw a line (line\\_6) with start point [0.0, 0.3849] and end point [0.0, 0.3302]. After sketching, scale the sketch with a scaling factor of 0.75. Now, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translation vector [0.0, 0.5478, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.5478 units along the Z-axis to obtain the 3D model. **Part 2: Create a CAD model by cutting out a semi-circle from the original model.** Start by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] - Translation Vector: [0.042, 0.3118, 0.3302] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system and draw two circles (circle\\_1 and circle\\_2) as follows: - circle\\_1 with Center at [0.0379, 0.0379] and Radius of 0.0379. - circle\\_2 with Center at [0.2753, 0.0379] and Radius of 0.0379. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.2283 units along the -Z direction using the "CutFeatureOperation" boolean operation.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Creating the Base of the Prism with Curved Sides** The first part of the CAD model is a rectangular prism with a curved top and bottom. **Step 1: Creating the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees and the Translation Vector to 0.0, 0.05, 0.0. This will position the prism slightly above the origin and rotate it so that the curved surfaces face downwards. **Step 2: Drawing the Sketch** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. **Face 1** *Loop 1* 1. Draw a line from the point (0.05, 0.05) to (0.65, 0.0). 2. Draw an arc from the point (0.65, 0.0) to (0.65, 0.2) with a midpoint at (0.75, 0.1). 3. Draw a line from (0.65, 0.2) to (0.05, 0.15). 4. Draw an arc from (0.05, 0.15) to (0.05, 0.05) with a midpoint at (0.0, 0.1). *Loop 2* 1. Draw a line from (0.05, 0.0625) to (0.65, 0.0125). 2. Draw an arc from (0.65, 0.0125) to (0.65, 0.1875) with a midpoint at (0.7375, 0.1). 3. Draw a line from (0.65, 0.1875) to (0.05, 0.1375). 4. Draw an arc from (0.05, 0.1375) to (0.05, 0.0625) with a midpoint at (0.0125, 0.1). **Step 3: Scaling the Sketch** Scale the sketch by 75% (0.75) to reduce the size of the loops proportionally. **Step 4: Extruding the Sketch** Extrude the sketch by 0.05 units towards the normal, and 0 units in the opposite direction of the normals. This will create the base of the prism with the curved sides. **Step 5: Extracting the Description** Extract the shape information from the description. The shape is described as a "CAD model of a rectangular prism with a curved top and bottom. The prism has a flat bottom and a flat top, and its sides are parallel to each other. The curved top and bottom are smooth and rounded. The prism is centered on a white background." Also, note the length (0.75), width (0.05), and height (0.75) for future reference.</description>
